page.title: 05S.M.B.A.,CONNEL
page.content: In 1970 the Scottish Marine Biological Association came to Dunbeg from Millport where this science of the sea began about 100 years ago.The Dunbeg site which was an old war camp was ideal for several reasons_central position for carrying out work round islands,superb anchorage,welcomng landowner,housing available,etc. There is a staff of 90,half of whom are scientists.There are 9 divers. On the site there is a caretaker's house,research laboratories,wood/metal workshops,conference room,12 room hostel,canteen,reference library, computer room,etc. A major programme of work has been carried out at Rockall over the last 15 years.The boats which are used come in to the floating pontoon pier which is connected by metal ramp to land.
